Scenes.Scene Heading: FADE IN: EXT. WASHINGTON, D.C. STREET - DAY
Scenes.Description: Music is playing from Mandy's B.M.W. convertible as she drives down the street. As she stops for the red light, she sees three people across the street near the Capitol Building. She honks the car's horn several times. Senator LLOYD RUSSELL is one of the three men. He looks at the car and shakes his head. As the traffic light turns green, Mandy drives fast across the street, through and against the curb, and leaves her car there.

Dialogues.Line: [yells] Are you crazy?! She jumps out of her convertible without opening the door. She rushes toward Russell, who is with two men from his staff.
Why don't we go to my office, we can talk about it...
Why did you make that deal?
Lady, I don't think you can leave your car right there...
Shut up! [to Lloyd] Why did you make that deal?
It's just until after the midterms, Mandy.
We keep the bill in committee until after the midterms, and that way...
And that way, the White House doesn't have to veto it until nobody's looking.
We wanted people to be looking!
[to Lloyd] Senator, we really should be moving along here.
Lloyd, what? Why? Why did you go to breakfast to make that deal?
They offered us a good spot at the nominating convention.
That's true. I might nominate the President.
Of course, they offered you something good at the nominating convention. They don't want you to get nominated at the nominating convention!
That bill was our coming out party. We were gonna have the stage for a month! It was our Nesun Dorma!
It's an Italian aria by Wagner...
It's Puccini. Wagner's German, and you're a moron.
[approaches] Excuse me, ma'am. Is everything all right?

No, everything is not all right! I left a job at a top-tier marketing firm where I had stock options. I come down here and get this guy elected President. But he went to breakfast this morning, and made a deal at 443 until after the midterm elections. Avoiding the national exposure that was our ONLY HOPE of making any kind of a challenge! [The man has left already.]
Hang on. [Mandy and Russell walk away from other two guys.]
Listen to meOe It wasn't gonna happen. Maybe somewhere down the road. But this year, it wasn't gonna happen.
I had two years to make it happen. I was gonna take them on! They beat me before I got my boxes unpacked.
You'll bounce back. You've got spunk.
[quickly takes off her shoe] I could kill you with my shoe!
Mandy! Mandy! Mandy! It wasn't gonna happen.
You know what the worst part about this is?
[looks at the car] Well, I think you dinged up your suspension pretty good.
No, Lloyd. It's the party they're having right now in the West Wing at my expense.
They're not having a party in the West Wing.
I worked with these people for two and a half years. They like to win and then they like to gloat.
There are very serious men and women in the White House. A blow was struck for party unity this morning. There's no cause to gloat.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE WHITE HOUSE - JOSH'S BULLPEN AREA - DAY

Dialogues.Line: [comes out of his office] Victory is mine! Victory is mine! Great day in the morning people. Victory is mine!
I drink from the keg of glory, Donna. Bring me the finest muffins and bagels in all the land.
It's gonna be an unbearable day. Donna hangs her jacket. Josh throws up his arms in victory in front of the other staffers, who are clapping for him.

Scenes.Scene Heading: SMASH CUT TO: MAIN TITLES.
FADE IN: INT. COMMUNICATIONS OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: Toby comes out of his office and heads out. C.J. follows.

Dialogues.Line: They turned down. They declined the invitation.
How does someone decline an invitation for a photo-op with the President?
I'm saying this is the kind of luck we're having.
You try getting his attention on this. OUTER OVAL OFFICE. Mrs. Landingham is behind her desk. Toby approaches.
Mrs. Landingham, does the President have free time this morning?
The President has nothing but free time, Toby. Right now he's in the residence eating Cheerios and enjoying Regis and Kathie Lee. Should I get him for you?
Sarcasm's a disturbing thing coming from a woman of your age, Mrs. Landingham.
What age would that be, Toby?
[opens the cookie jar] Can I have a cookie?
[walks in] Toby, they turned down our request?
Thank you. [takes a cookie] Toby, still holding the cookie jar lid, looks at Mrs. Landingham. She looks back.
They're issuing a press release. We're gonna be playing defense all day.
[mouthful] Is this really because of the joke?
It's because of the joke. Josh steps in. Donna stays at the door.
Someone give me a river to forge, a serpent to slay.
He's been drinking from the keg of glory. We're to bring him all the muffins and bagels in the land.
Thank you very much. C.J., they turned down the invitation?
They declined. The staff walks into THE OVAL OFFICE.
It means they turned down the invitation.
Of course, because of the joke. Why does everyone keep asking? As if it could be something... Josh and C.J. pass through as Bartlet and Leo come in from the portico.
That's no good. Jaworski knows that's no good.
Mostly, he's gonna say that the Japanese need to buy more American cars.
Americans need to buy more American cars.
Which is what I told Jaworski.
The Ryder Cup team is declining our invitation to come to the White House.
I'm not. Mrs. Landingham comes in and gives Bartlet his schedule.
It's a group of the best golfers in the country...
I know what the Ryder Cup team is. Thanks Mrs. Landingham.
Sir, this may be a good time to talk about your sense of humor.

[looks at his schedule] I've got an intelligence briefing, a security briefing, and a 90-minute budget meeting all scheduled for the same 45 minutes. You sure this is a good time to talk about my sense of humor?
It's just that it's not the first time it's happened.
U.S.A. Today asks you why you don't spend more time campaigning in Texas and you say it's 'cause you don't look good in funny hats.
The point is we got whomped in Texas.
We got whomped in Texas twice.
We got whomped in the primary, and we got whomped in November.
C.J., on your tombstone, it's gonna read, 'Post hoc, ergo propter hoc.'
Okay, but none of my visitors are going to be able to understand my tombstone.
Twenty-seven lawyers in the room, anybody know 'post hoc, ergo propter hoc?' Josh?
Uh, uh, post, after, after hoc, ergo, therefore, after hoc, therefore, something else hoc.
Uh, if I'd gotten more credit on the 443...
After it, therefore because of it. [Josh, a little weirded out, looks]

After it, therefore because of it. It means one thing follows the other, therefore it was caused by the other, but it's not always true. In fact, it's hardly ever true. We did not lose Texas because of the hat joke. Do you know when we lost Texas?
When you learned to speak Latin?

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. OUTER OVAL OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: CAPTAIN MORRIS TOLLIVER, the President's physician, comes in. NANCY greets him.

Dialogues.Line: Captain Tolliver, can I get you a cup of coffee?
No, I'm fine, Nancy. Thank you.
Good morning, Morris. It's good to see you.
He's a little backed up this morning.
I can see that. The door to the Oval Office opens. Leo, Sam, Josh, and other staffers come out.
Sam, when are you writing the Hilton Head draft?
I'm closing my door from noon to three.
Let me see it at three.
Stan, I'll be just a second. [to Morris] Take a walk with me, will you?
Well, I don't know... Let me see... Well, what do you know? [fishes out a picture]
I'm sorry. I've forgotten your wife's name.
Corey. Margaret comes from behind as they enter the COMMUNICATIONS OFFICE. Leo and Morris stop walking.
Leo, did you tell the council's office that they would be in on the ten o'clock?
That's really something that you want to tell me.
[hands her the picture] Here. It's a baby and a new mother. Look at that for a minute.
Oh! Leo and Morris walk again. Margaret follows while looking at the picture.
Listen, quickly. I know you were just supposed to be filling in till Terry Wyatt came back, but the President likes you, and he'd like to keep you on if you don't have any objections.
But I don't have to be covered next week. I'm leaving the country in a few hours.
Then you'll start the week after.
He likes you, Morris. He feels better after he's talked to you. I think there have been days when you've lightened the load a little.
It's not the big load, I'm just...
He likes you, Morris. I got to get back in the Oval. [to Margaret] Give him his picture. Leo walks off. Margaret gives Morris back his picture and follows Leo.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: EXT. MANDY'S CONDOMINIUM - DAY
Scenes.Description: Mandy's convertible is being towed outside. Inside, Mandy walks in. She finds her assistant, DAISY, inside.

Dialogues.Line: 88-B's straightened out, and Chris Matthews wants to know what we know.
Well, there's a way to see it as bad news, but I think it's good news.
Lloyd Russell is no longer our client.
Lloyd Russell is our only client.
What happened? This is a total disaster!
Look, if that's the spin you're gonna put on it...
He wants to work with the President on 443.
I'd like to think of us as a team, Daisy.
After putting about a half a million dollars in the bank.
How are you gonna pay me?
Can I just say that it so typically you to leap that question at a time like this?
It's not typically me, Mandy. It's typically my landlord. It's typically college loans. It's typically the guy who's gonna sell me a carton of milk next week.
You're not the only one with expenses, Daisy. I've got credit cards, and I've got condo payments, plus I think I may have dinged up the suspension on my
I'm formulating a plan. Mandy walks inside a bathroom and closes the door.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE WEST WING - HALLWAY - DAY

Dialogues.Line: You owe me a hundred dollars.
I entered you in a college football pool.
Well, it's kind of a surprise.
It wasn't really that kind of a pool.
What kind of a pool was it?
You picked Central Indiana State against Notre Dame?
Well, technically, you did. Toby passes them. Josh calls him as Donna walks off. We follow Toby and Josh.
The Ryder Cup is just the latest in a string.
Yes, though I'm not sure what our new media director would have done about that.
Me neither, but we need a new media director. I'd been on talent shows with more polish than some of the events around here.
If we bring Sam and C.J. too.
We need to gang up on.
We do it as a gang.
See you later. Josh stops walking as Toby continues down the hall.
Listen, it's not gonna be Mandy, right?
Anyone but Mandy. Toby had walked near C.J.'s Office. He sees C.J. as they head off.
'Post hoc ergo propter hoc'? I'll bet that used to have them rolling in the aisles at the Whiffinpoof Dinners.
Fly in the teeth with it.
Be funny. You're at your best with a pie in the face.
In fact, I'd hold back. Keep it in your back pocket.
If you don't like the rhythm of the 'Q' and 'A,' use the Ryder Cup. Just fly in the teeth with it.
Yeah. C.J. and Toby walk off. The staffer JANET speaks into the P.A.

[into P.A.] Please take your seats. Please take your seats, folks. We're gonna start the briefing. PRESS BRIEFING ROOM. C.J. and Toby walk in. We continue to hear Janet from the P.A. while C.J. walks toward the podium as the reporters take their seats.
Please take your seats. Please take your seats, folks.
Good morning. We got a birthday today, right? Suzanne?

C.J.? Uh, a short while ago the Vice President commented on the White House's position on the A3-C3 saying, and I'm quoting from notes, 'This is the time when the President needs our support.' Can you clarify the language?
No. I can't, Mike. I haven't spoken with the Vice President today.
The language seemed strained, doesn't it?
[glances at Toby, then back at Mike] Strange?
Strained. 'This is the time when the President needs our support.'

It sounds pretty straightforward. I'll tell you what though, if you consult the morning releases, you'll see that in the world of sports, the White House just got dissed by 12 guys named Flippy. Laughter. C.J. looks at Toby, who is smiling at her response. We zoom out of the PRESS ROOM.
C.J., does this have anything to do with the joke, and is the President planning on making an apology?

Scenes.Scene Heading: FADE IN: INT. JOSH'S BULLPEN AREA - DAY
Scenes.Description: Josh is watching C.J.'s briefing from a nearby television. Sam comes up.

Dialogues.Line: [on T.V.] I have to say that it came as a bit of a surprise to discover that professional golfers don't have a sense of humor, especially after seeing them in some of the outfits.
[starts walking with Sam] C.J. just discovered that Hoynes, when responding to a question on A3, said 'this is the time when the President needs our support.' Third one in five weeks.
So she moved on to the Ryder Cup?
Yeah. [beat] Listen, make sure C.J. keeps this off Leo's desk.
I think it goes right on Leo's desk.
A vague quote from Hoynes will disappear by the end of the next news cycle. A fistfight between Leo and the Vice President's got juice.
Yeah. I will. One he gets his coffee, Josh walks away. After a while he notices that Sam is following him.
Didn't you come to see me?
I was just stretching my legs.
Oh. They walk into JOSH'S OFFICE.
I'm supposed to be working on the Hilton Head draft right now, and I am, but I'm just stretching my legs.

Last week, I was out for a late drink, and I met this woman named Laurie, and Laurie and I hit it off, and we spent the evening together back at her place, and the next day I discovered she was a call girl. Josh has been drinking his coffee. He's having a hard time swallowing.
Do you want to maybe close the door?
You slept with a call girl?
Well no, I... well, yes. Yes I did.
Did she know who you are?
No, I didn't reveal my secret identity, Josh.
Yes. She knows I work for the President.
No, I'm saying no, she wouldn't say anything.
You want to call her again, don't you?
Look, I really like her, and she's not what you think.
The only thing I know about her is she's a call girl. Is she a call girl?
Then so far she's exactly what I think.
I just think I left abruptly. I think it was rude.
Oh, you're gonna try and reform her, aren't you?
I just didn't say a proper goodbye that, you know, shows a little respect.
You know what, you'd like her if you met her, Josh.
You got to promise me this is never gonna happen, Sam. Donna knocks and pokes her head in.
You're with the Energy Secretary in five minutes.
Whatever. You're playing with fire here. Just talk to Toby before you do anything.
There's no way that I can do this without talking to Toby?
No. [opens the door and sees C.J. walking by] Ooh! Ooh! Hang on there. C.J.! [to Sam] Just talk to Toby. Just Toby.
All right. Josh walks out. Donna gives him a file. He catches up with C.J.
I would definitely talk to him.
Oh, I'm gonna talk to him, all right.
I want you to stay on the perimeter.
I've been staying on the perimeter.
I don't want it on Leo's desk. Thank you Josh stops as C.J. continues to walk a little faster. C.J. lets out a loud, angry scream. Some staffers look at her strangely as she walks down the hall.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE MURAL ROOM - DAY
Scenes.Description: VICE PRESIDENT JOHN HOYNES is inside talking to a Frenchman. Several reporters surround the room as their cameras flash everywhere.

Dialogues.Line: C'est un vrai plasir et un honneur. D'etre votre hote aujurd'hui que vous surviviez cette challeure du fin de septembre. Et que ce jour soit le jour ou on construit pour le future.
Excellent. C.J. comes in the room and stands next to STEVIE one of the Vice President's staffers.
[to Frenchman] Good luck. [to everyone in general] Thank you. Good luck everyone. Hoynes heads for the door as C.J. approaches him. His staff follows behind as they walk hurriedly down the hall.
Sir, I-I wanted to talk to you for a moment about A3-C3.
I wanted to apologize since I've been quickly here and in getting everyone on the same page, sometimes people get left behind for a day or two...
[to a staffer behind him] Candy, the most he was talking about in terms of the subsidy was six dollars an acre.
I was saying that had we properly briefed your office...
[to another staffer] Bill, it was six dollars an acre, Candy said.
C.J., it was nice of you to come find me, but I've been kept in the loop on AC cubed.
The quote the room is running with is, 'This is the time when the President needs our support.'
Well, you can see how that might be interpreted...?
[suddenly stops walking and everyone with him]  C.J.?
I've got my own press secretary.
Yes, sir. C.J. falls silent. She stares at Hoynes as he and his staff walk away.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: THE OVAL OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: Bartlet is having his physical check-up. Morris has just finished taking his blood pressure.

Dialogues.Line: You should stay here. We got Amman, a woman, little kids, the works.
Good for you. How long are you gonna stay?
Thought you'd never ask. [gives him one]
[comes in] Sir, they just touched down at Andrews.
Thank you, Nancy. Nancy leaves. Bartlet looks at the picture.
Oh, she's beautiful. What's her name?
Angela's my wife. Corey's our daughter. It's my grandmother's name. She got it from her great aunt, who got it from the first free woman she ever met.
That name's got a hell of a past.
My family's very proud of its past as you can tell.
Your wife's beautiful too. How'd you get her to marry you? Did you trick her or something?
Yeah, I figured. [beat] Morris, I made a joke about golfers yesterday, and now it consumes the whole damn building.
Jokes like that are part of my folksy charm, Morris. It's the very heart of my popularity.
Don't you have a job approval rating of like three percent or something?
Oh, we're having some difficulty getting the word out. Carol comes in and gives Bartlet a file.
Oh, thank you. Is this from this morning, Carol?
Have you been running up and down the stairs at the Rose Bowl in the past few minutes?
Then it's not that good. Cut back on red meat?
[jokingly] Yeah, why not? Two Dewars on the rocks, Mrs. Landingham.

I had a meeting this morning with the Joint Chiefs. [beat] I'm an accomplished man, Morris. I can sit comfortably with prime ministers and Presidents, even the pope. Why is it every time I sit with the Joint Chiefs, I feel like I'm back at my father's dinner table.
You're a naval officer. You're a doctor in a uniform. [beat] It's not like I'm totally without experience, you know.
You're talking to a former governor. I was commander-in-chief of the New Hampshire National Guard.
You guys got into a lot of tough scrapes, did you?
Didn't have to. We'd just stand on the border and stare you down. Then we'd all go for pancakes. Like you had a lot of closed infantry combat training in premed, huh?
I don't need a flu shot.
You do need a flu shot.
How do I know this isn't the start of a military coup?
I want the Secret Service in here right away.
In the event of a military coup, sir, what makes you think the Secret Service is gonna be on your side?
Now that's a thought that's gonna fester.
Hold still. Morris gives him the flu shot. Bartlet groans a little, and then holds his arm after the shot.

Thank you. I'm not comfortable with violence. [beat] I know this country has enemies, but I don't feel violent toward any of them. I don't know whether that's a weakness or not, but I think I know how the Joint Chiefs would answer that question.

Let the chiefs get to know you, Mr. President. They're serious men, naturally suspicious of your leadership. That's what comes from spending a lifetime caught between the devil and the deep blue sea. They're men of character. They may not like your rEsumE, but they'll like you personally if you give it time. [beat] You have a once in a generation mind, sir. Ultimately, they'll respect that. They'll advise you well and go where you point. Let the chiefs get to know you, sir. In the meantime, you outrank them. So don't worry about it so much, and cut back on the dairy.
Don't forget your picture. Corey's a beautiful child.
[looks at picture] Yeah, I know. Look what I'd done.
You didn't do nothing, mister. You were a passenger on this one. Your job is to pay the bills, and do what these ladies tell you to do.
Also, you got to teach her how to whistle. Her mother won't do that.
I'll see you next week, Morris.
Right. [Morris heads for the door.] Morris?
Look at that picture again. See? The past isn't the only thing your family can be proud of.
Go away. Morris leaves. He passes Leo walking inside with two distinguished men.
Mr. President, you remember Stuart White and Ray Finley?
I do, indeed. Mr. White, good to see you. Mr. Finley... WHITE and FINLEY shake hands with the President.

Scenes.Scene Heading: FADE IN: INT. JOSH'S BULLPEN AREA - DAY
Scenes.Description: Donna and Josh are walking through the bullpen.

Dialogues.Line: What do you want for the pool this Saturday?
You can't win if you don't play.
Who do you like? Rocky Mountain College or Purdue?
Tell you what, can you give me Yeshiva University over the Dallas Cowboys?
If you're not going to take this seriously...
[walks up] Excuse me. Leo will be ready for us in about a half hour.
Leo will call when he's ready.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. MANDY'S CONDO - DAY
Scenes.Description: Mandy is sitting in the stairs. Daisy picks up a wine bottle and joins Mandy in the stairs.

Dialogues.Line: I have a Ph.D. Did you know that?
I've got a bachelor's degree in art history, and a master's degree in communications and a Ph.D. in political science.
I'm accomplished and brilliant. And yet, look how young and cute I am.
And who would think that someone who'd accomplished as much as I have, would be this young or this cute?
I am not calling Gil Mcgregor!
I'm not cold-calling businesses like an encyclopedia salesman.
You do it. [Daisy gives her a knowing look] No. Neither of us has to do it. Things haven't gotten that bad.
Miss Hampton, we are sitting on the stairs, drinking wine out of paper cups.
I'd like it if you called me Dr. Hampton.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. COMMUNICATIONS OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: Outside Sam's office, a phone rings. Cathy answers it.

Dialogues.Line: He's writing now, Danny. He asked me to hold his calls.
He just came out. I'll have him call you back.

I'm done tweaking, I'm done polishing. Done. Take it to C.J. [Cathy starts to walk.] Wait. [looks at the speech one final time, to double check] Yes, I'm done, really. Cathy walks towards C.J.'s Office with papers from Sam. Behind him, TOBY'S OFFICE opens. Sam walks towards it where a meeting is breaking up. Toby is speaking to communications staffers Ed and Larry leaving his office.
Wait and hope that the statement comes out of the U.N. by the end of the week.
It's the least we can do.
No, actually the U.N. is already doing the least they can do.
You're talking about the Hilton head draft?
I used pretty tough language... 'political cover,' 'counterproductive.'
Now, I'm just stretching my legs.
Can I talk to you a second?
[closes the door and sits] About a week ago, I accidentally slept with a prostitute. Toby slowly looks up from his desk to Sam.
You accidentally slept with a prostitute?
I don't understand. Did you trip over something?
I did not know she was a call girl.
There wasn't a red flag when she charged you money in exchange for sex?
She didn't charge me, Toby, come on... I didn't find out about it, till the next day.
Yes, although I was with Billy for a time.
He sat, to talk to me about Josh. It was during the whole Mary Marsh thing, but he got up and left well before...
Before you picked up a hooker.
Well, that's a distinction that's gonna be very important to the Grand Jury.
So it's just me, you, the hooker, the President's deputy chief of staff, and The Wall Street Journal!
You know what Toby? She's not a hooker.
I'd like to call her, just to say we can be friends, I don't see the danger in that...
[rubs his forehead] No, no, Sam, no. You're going to try and reform her?
I think she shouldn't have to feel like trash, because I have a job where adults aren't given the benefit of the doubt.
Yeah. Toby looks at Sam before leaving. They all walk.
[to Josh]  Did you know about this?
Who among us hasn't known forbidden love, Toby? Why spring break alone...
This administration doesn't even need an opposition party, do you know that, we do fine by ourselves.
Sam, just don't do anything stupid okay?
Nice job on the Hilton head draft. The three enter LEO'S OFFICE. C.J. and Leo are already there.
You have three minutes, what do you want?

The dollar is down 3 cents against the Yen; up 2 pennies against the Euro. Know what we need more than a media consultant?  An economic stimulus package that doesn't look like it was put together at an Amway rally.
Yes, but that's not the meeting we're having right now.
The Ryder Cup shouldn't have even ended up on our radar screen.
So you'll let us hire a media consultant? You'll let the D.N.C. spend some money?
Who is recently unemployed, and by the way, I don't think Josh has gotten enough credit for that. [She applauds. Sam joins in.]
Wait a second. This is an ambush.
I'm getting mugged and you're the gang leader.
Can you think of a single reason not to use Mandy that isn't personal?
[beat] She used to be my girlfriend!
That's good enough for me. Let's do it.
This is going to be great.
For one thing, the President would never go for this.
How do you know? LEO and JOSH I [You] already asked him.
All right... listen... fine... I'm a team player. I think my record is pretty clear on that.
As long as she understands that she answers to me and she answers to Toby. I don't want to have to go 15 rounds with her in the Oval Office.
Toby, does that wrap it up?
I'm going to draw a chart for her with lines and arrows, clearly indicating that she answers to me and she answers to Toby.
C.J., hang on a second. Everyone leaves. C.J. stands just inside the door.
Did you talk to Hoynes today?
Yeah, I talked to him for a minute this morning.
I don't understand, what kind of miscommunication?
His statement got truncated, I'd leave it alone.
I'll be in my office. C.J. leaves. Josh suddenly comes back in from the other door to make his point.
She answers to me and she answers to Toby. Leo shakes his head as Josh leaves.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE OVAL OFFICE - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Bartlet is packing his briefcase. Mrs. Landingham is with him.

Dialogues.Line: There are some calls, but you can make them from the residence. [gives him a file and a red paper bag]
All righty. Thank you. What's in the bag?
Delegation from the University of Nebraska was sorry you couldn't see them during their visit, and they left this for you with their compliments. [pulls out a red shirt from the bag]
I think they left me something else, Mrs. Landingham.
I think they left me 12 center-cut prime fillet Omaha Steaks, Mrs. Landingham.
I was going to have Mario fix me one of those steaks tonight. He walks out into the PORTICO. Mrs. Landingham follows.
Dr. Tolliver was very clear about...
I didn't steal them. I was simply following the direct orders of Captain Morris Tolliver, M.D. who would like to see your diet contain a little less...
You are a cattle rustler, Mrs. Landingham.
If you say so, Mr. President... And no scotch tonight, sir.
Between you and Dr. Tolliver, who needs a wife or a mother?
Good night, Mr. President. Bartlet walks toward the residence. Mrs. Landingham returns to the office.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. MANDY'S CONDO - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Mandy sits on the stairs and Daisy sits on the floor. They're going over a list.

Dialogues.Line: How about the one from Indiana?
No. The two don't notice Josh entering.
Bartlet. Mandy and Daisy swiftly look at him.
Jed Bartlet, Nobel Laureate in Economics, three-term congressman, two-term Governor, You guys look like you could use a client. What do you say? You want to work for the leader of the free world?
[approaches] Josh! Well it took you long enough. [hits Josh in the arm]
You kept me out of the loop for a year. Sure, once the Ryder cup team...
I don't want to hear your rules.
Number one, she can't punch me. Number two, I prefer it if the two of you didn't get drunk in the middle of the day.
Oh, you don't know how much we appreciate this, Josh.
It's not like he's doing us a favor.
You are a good man, Josh!
Yes, I really am quite something.
We don't even know how to thank you.
The look on Mandy's face is thanks enough. Get your coats. You hungry?

Lets go. Rule number 3, and I really can't emphasize this enough, you answer to me and you answer to Toby. My office is drawing up some instructional charts that pretty much outline the chain of command. For instance, you answer to me and you answer to Toby.
Good. The three start to go out.
In your little dreams! Daisy turns off the lights and closes the door. Leo is reading. Margaret walks in.
Excuse me. The Vice President is here.
Thanks, Margaret. Margaret leaves the office. Leo and Hoynes sit in opposite ends.
Standard and Poor's going to raise the city's credit rating.
Nice of you to call me over. We don't see enough of each other.
Did you blow off C.J. Cregg this morning?
Is that what this is about?
You know what, C.J. doesn't need to come running to you every time she hits a bump...
C.J. did not come running, John, she covered your ass, she's a good girl. And when she tells you something, I want you to consider it a directive from this office.
You want me to consider it a directive from this office?
Well, let me consult Article Two of the Constitution, cause I'm not a hundred percent sure where this office gets the authority to direct me to the men's room!
You really want to do this now?
Leo, I have had it up to here, with you and your pal! I've been shoved into a broom...
[gets riled] Excuse me! Me and my pal?
You are referring to President Bartlet?
Don't do what you're doing, John.
You're a world class political operative, Leo. Why the hell shouldn't I keep doing what I've been doing?
'Cause I'll win, and you'll end up playing celebrity golf for the rest of your life.
How long do you expect me to stick around here and be his whipping boy?
Give this President anything less than your full-throated support, and you're going to find out exactly how long.
Goodnight, John. Hoynes leaves. Leo picks up the paperwork from the table and continues to read.

Scenes.Scene Heading: FADE IN: INT. THE FOUR SEASONS - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Sam comes in the restaurant. He looks around the place full of distinguished people. He sees a familiar woman by the bar and approaches her.

Dialogues.Line: I don't know anyone named Laurie.
Actually, Laurie is her real name. The name you know her by is not her real name. I saw her with you the other night.
Ah. More good news for Toby.
Nothing. Could you tell me where she is?
Only take a sec! IN THE BACK AREA. We see Laurie sitting with two older men and another woman around a table.
Hongkong? That place has really gone downhill since they changed chefs. Everyone in the table laughs. Sam just walks up.
Look at this. I come in for a drink, and here you are.
I hope you don't mind my barging in like this. It's just that I've known this girl my whole life.
Sam, we're in the middle of something here...

No problem. I don't mean to interrupt. I'll just go back to the bar and call my friend, the Assistant U.S. Attorney General, and see if he wants to come down and meet for a drink with me and that woman back there.
[to man] Good to meet you. [to the other man] Okay. Laurie comes out of the restaurant. Sam is walking behind her.
Laurie. I called you four times. You said you were gonna call me back.
I can't believe you just did that!
I came here in the spirit of...
I left my jacket at the table. I can't go back there.
If I cost you some money, I'll write you a check.
You go to hell for saying that.
I wasn't... [Laurie walks off ahead of Sam. He follows behind.] I'm sorry. That was the wrong thing to say.

Give it to me. [She stops. Sam helps her put on the coat.] I can't believe you said that in there. I backed away from you so quietly, Sam. You know I did. I never would have caused you any trouble. And then you come in and you brandish this... by the way, the Attorney General has no jurisdiction here. [walks again]

I break the law in the district. I break the law in Maryland. And from time to time, I break the law in Pennsylvania. In my life, I have never committed a federal crime, which is more than I can say for some people in your line of work.
I need a cab. [waves to a cab passing by but it didn't stop]
So I had a pretty good day.
I feel like more and more I'm putting a role in policy discussions and then today I...
Why did you come and find me tonight?
Why did you call me four times, and then come and find me?
I just... to tell you that I had a pretty good day.
Are you aware that I make more money than you do?
You and any kid with a decent paper route.
And you understand that I wasn't abused as a child, that I like what I do?
That it's putting me through law school?
I wouldn't knock yourself out in torts because there's no state law in this country that's gonna admit you with a solicitation bust on your record.
I don't plan on getting busted.
As opposed to the other people that do?
And I gotta tell you... [They stop walking.] I think you look terrific tonight.
And I'm not just saying that because I want my coat back.
You're gonna try and change me, arguing, asserting a position every time I turn around...
I'm a lawyer and a speechwriter. I argue for a living, and I'm sought after because I'm good at it.
You humiliated me back there. And you scared me. You understand that?
I guess that's just the way it goes.
'Cause I've decided to become a good friend of yours.
Oh, am I just supposed to strip down for you now?
So what are we supposed to do?
I don't know, but whatever it is, can we do it indoors because I'm from Southern California.
You want to buy me a drink?
I have to say, that sounded very professional to me.
Okay. They start walking, but this time, we don't follow them.
So you're gonna reveal state secrets?
To be honest with you, I don't think I know any state secrets.
I can recite the members of Congress in alphabetical order.
Ooh, geez, Sam. How do the girls stay on their feet with you?
And I got some patter with the capital gains tax, too. Laurie laughs as they continue to walk away.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE WHITE HOUSE - HALLWAY - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: 3:35 A.M. There is an unusual crowding in the White House hallways at this time of night. There are numbers of staffers walking. Among them, we see Toby coming in the Roosevelt Room.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE WHITE HOUSE PORTICO - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: President Bartlet, wearing a sweatshirt and jeans, walks towards the Oval Office. He passes by a Secret Service Agent, who whispers to the mike on his wrist.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE ROOSEVELT ROOM - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Leo and Josh are with several military officers.

Dialogues.Line: So they'll be in position in two hours?
And they'd be booked up by a second carrier group plus the F-14s off the George Washington and the Carlston.
How long before an estimated B.D.A.?
[walks up from behind Leo] The President's waiting.
Excuse me, gentlemen. [heads for the door]
No. Leo leaves. We see Toby and Sam looking on in the other end of the room.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE OVAL OFFICE - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: The President is leaning on his desk. Leo comes in and walks slowly toward him.

Dialogues.Line: Mr. President, Morris Tolliver is dead. The bad news hits the President hard.

An airforce transport carrying Morris, 1200 other doctors, 42 support staff, and a crew of five to a teaching hospital in Amman exploded in midair about 150 miles north of Tartus. What was first thought to be a mechanical failure was then claimed by a fundamentalist group after a keyhole satellite sent back a record of a heat stream coming from what's called an F.I.M. 92, which is a shoulder-mounted surface-to-air missile launcher. In the last 90 minutes or so that's been debunked as well. Hard intelligence is telling us the order came from the Syrian defense ministry. Baker and Lennox are on their way from the Pentagon, and Brodie's in the Situation Room preparing for your briefing. Bartlet takes a moment before he speaks.
He's at his residence on a secure phone line.
Alright, uh... [big sigh] I'm gonna call Morris' wife now. I'll meet you in the Situation Room.

I am not frightened. I'm gonna blow them off the face of the earth with the fury of God's own thunder. [beat] Get the commanders. A look of concern is on Leo's face. He slowly turns around, opens the door and leaves. From the portico, we see Bartlet walking around behind his desk. He sits on his chair and lets out a big sigh. He then picks up the phone and makes the call.

Scenes.Scene Heading: DISSOLVE TO: END TITLES.
